text: Tap at Mellow. Pours a clear gold with a finger of foam that lingers. Wow, big dank grapefruit and iyokan notes. Endless dank and citrus, really great nose! Clean and crisp, light body. Lingering dank and citrus on the palate as well. Perfect for summer.
A very tasty pale ale that I somehow forgot to rate. Easy to drink, hoppy and sessionable. Yum.

I thought I had born again, but this is dated 10/17/16, oh well. Hazy yellow beer, white head. Aroma is juicy lychee and spruce. Taste is lychee, orange, mango. Palatenis smooth, carbonation moderate.

Bottle->Ocelot glass. Hazy gold with small offwhite head. A: juicy citrus and floral hops, tropical fruit, caramel malt. Tangerine, pineapple and orange coming thru. T: bittersweet citrus and pine, juicy and dank, with caramel malt coming on. Lasting bittersweet aftertaste. Nice!

12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy weak grassy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy grassy finish.

pours cloudy yellow gold with a thickish white bubbly head. Strong citrus aroma. Full rich juicy mouth feel. Intense grapefruit citrus taste. Long bittersweet to bitter finish. A hopheads delight. Outstanding!
On draft at Mad Mex Lakeside. Poured hazy orange with thin head, scattered lace. Orange and tropical fruit. Really nice APA.

Perfect blend of hop madness with a crowd-pleasing lack of bitter vitriol. Huge vegetal hop front, full of massive weed and tart grapefruit and green pepper, leading into a mellow, grain-hinted middle and a long, slow, easygoing hop fade. Top Chef buzzword description: Fresh, bright, simple, accents the hops without overpowering the palate. Tasty, in other words.
Aroma is fresh/dank hops, pine and spices. The flavor is fresh grapefruit, complex fruit punch, tropical fruit, malts and a mix of hops, bitter, spicy and slight sourness in the finish.

Pours hazy gold with a medium white head. Aroma is citrus, floral and more citrus. Taste is moderate bitters with some tart undertones. Medium bodied with a crisp finish. Very enjoyable as it is a nice combo of juicy aromatic hops.

Bottle sent for review: "Born on" Oct. 17, tasted Oct. 21. What we have poured here is a very cloudy yellow beer, almost wit-like in body, under a puffy white head that dwindles away, leaving some sudsy legs around the rim. Pine resin predominated the smell, with some notes of tangerine and grapefruit in the background.
Theres no poetic way to say; the taste is a hop monster. bursting with pine and bitterness, and citrus. Sometimes, a green-hopped beer can get notes of grass or vegetation in it, but that does not show here at all. The difference must be that this was boiled with wet hops, but not dry-hopped. And despite that unfiltered haze, theres no yeast bite in the way either.
The whole effect is something like rubbing some fresh cones in your hands, getting those little yellow bits of lupulins all over, and taking a big sniff. In fact, thats pretty good therapy!

It pours a nice clear gold color, pretty light with an off white head. The aroma is very potent with the typical Lagunitas sweet hoppiness. Ruby red grapefruit, papaya, a little onion spice and just a touch of florals. The flavor is equally as potent with a drier, danker mouthfeel. A little onion and pine combine with the sweet fruity hops for nice balance.

Bought at Krogers @ Swift Creek Midlothian Virginia on 12/2/16. 6 pack bottles with date in black ink on neck of bottle (extremely hard to see!!) 10/14/16 (YES I took a chance of the Hop profile not disintegrating!). Hazy gold color and then right away smelled the hops and tropical fruits emanting from the open bottle! Juicy Juicy Hops!! Citra forward and some dankness - bitterness and malts balance is good. Beautiful tasting beer! Outstanding money value! Even after a month and a half this beer still stands out and I wish I picked this up in October! Still a innovative and great brewery! Enjoy! Keep experimenting, Lagunitas!

Backlog - 10.31.16. 2016 one hitter. Yellow. Aroma is lots of citrus and juice. Pineapple. Somewhat dank. Taste is mild bitterness, juicy hops with a bit of sweetness. This is a damn good IPA from Lagunitas.

Golden-yellow very slightly hazy color with active carbonation. Slightly off-white, tall, bubbly head, receding slowly leaving a sticky lacing. Strong, citrus & piney aroma. Dominate hop flavor, citrus, pine. Mouth feel is somewhat thin. Malts are there, but definitely under the strong hop flavor, aroma, and bittering. Bittering asserts in the middle and remains very, very strong in the aftertaste. A very good, hoppy, pale ale (in reality, an IPA, though, to be honest). The fresh hop aroma is there, and the hop flavor is there, but it is a very bitter beer. Not exactly my preferred taste profile, but not bad for a macro brewer! ;-)

Vintage 2016, servida en una copa IPA Spiegelau.

APARIENCIA: de color amarillo, se observa medianamente turbia con una media a alta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco, de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: el lúpulo luce, de carácter muy frutal y ligeramente herbal; notas a moras azules característico de los lúpulos Mosaic, frutos tropicales como mango, maracuyá, duraznos, melón, papaya, algo ligeramente herbal como pasto recién cortado, pero el aroma a frutos tropicales es dominante.

SABOR: de inicio un amargor medio bajo que sigue a los frutos tropicales, como si fuera un jugo; notas nuevamente a moras azules, mango, maracuyá, duraznos melón, papaya, seguido del carácter herbal de los lúpulo, como si fuera pasto recién cortado, no llega a tener esas notas a pino o resina. El retrogusto queda un amargor medio bajo, con permanencia de los sabores de frutos tropicales.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con sensación oleosa en boca, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: excelente cerveza con buena selección de lúpulos.

pours cloudy yellow gold with a thickish white bubbly head. Strong citrus aroma. Full rich juicy mouth feel. Intense grapefruit citrus taste. Long bittersweet to bitter finish. A hopheads delight. Outstanding!

Bottle. Stowe Public House, VT. Pale gold. Soft haze. Thin, dense, lasting, white head. Nose has fresh and oily hop juice. Lots of citrus zest and rind. Some grape juice. A little yeasty and bready on the malts. Taste is zesty and clean bitter. Crisp palate. Juicy and zesty finish.

Omg. My fav beer at moment.....had growlers..... the appearance is perfect and cloudy....they should name this beer smooth haze...looks thick like a yeasty hef.....taste like something Wicked weed brewery would pull off....so smooth... like an IPA lite with great body.....heard this is unfortunately a seasonal? Unique quality aftertaste....

12oz bottle. Small off-white head atop clear light amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some orange. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some orange, light spicy. Light-medium body, light acidity.

Bottle from New Beer Distributors, Manhattan, New York, USA. A hazy golden/ orange coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Sweet, hoppy, malty, orange, grapefruit aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, malty, orange, grapefruit, a little pine, slightly sweet. This beer was the absolute bollox, I really loved it, went down so quickly. Top work from Lagunitas.
Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of crisp citrus and pine. Taste follows, big and bold hop bitterness. So fresh and earthy

12 oz bottle. 2016 version. The beer is a bright gold color. Its somewhat hazy. Large, thick white head. Clumps of bubbles on the walls of the glass. Sweet, juicy tropical and ctirus hop flavors in aroma. Really nice stuff. Pineapple, tangerine, kiwi, melon, grape, mango. Light pepper, pine, grass, as well. Light malt sweetness underneath. Mild to moderate bitterness. It picks up a bit in the finish and has a danker, piney flavor, which cuts out a bit of flavor. Still, lots of hop flavor comes through to the taste. Light feel with lots of hop oiliness. Very easy to drink and flavorful. Very enjoyable.
on tap pours golden amber. an abundance of citrus notable oranges and pineapple. mild dankness too. slight undertones of malt. ample bitterness. medium body. quaffable stuff

12 oz bottle, 2016 version. Pours hazy dark yellow gold with a big bubbly white head that retains well and leaves little lacing.

The aroma is sweet fruity malt with lots of resiny, piney, peppery, catty hops.

The flavor is sweet biscuity malt with a little sugary fruit and lot of resiny, piney, catty hops. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with low carbonation.

Overall, huge hops for a pale ale.
Poured from bottle hazy golden color with a thin white head. Aromas of juicy citrus grass and light pine. Taste is nice follows aroma with citrus forward and balanced hop finish. Well crafted.

Bottle from a lazy dog.
Hazy deep yellow color with a huge frothy white head that persists. Huge dank citrus on the nose is just incredible. Malt yeah maybe I guess. Sweet bready malt flavor is a bit more pronounced. Resinous earthy dank hop flavor with a touch of citrus and grass round this out nicely. Pretty tasty dankness.

Bottle pour into taster cup at One Stop Market 30th Anniversary. Appearance is lightly hazy, dark yellow with minimal head, light lacing. Aroma is super amount of citrusy, grapefruit hops with light pine. Taste is similar to aroma. Palate is light bodied with soft carbonation and mix of fruity and bitter finish. Overall, this is bursting with aroma and flavor--the freshness is killer. Borders on IPA territory.
Pours cloudy apricot with a thick off white head. Aroma is hot tropical. Just wow. Flavour is, is, is there anything other than hops? Finish is slightly thick and just off bitter. Noms.

On tap in a pint glass: Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aroma of light citrus, pineapple, light bread. Taste more of the same, lots of tropical notes, nice hop bitterness on the back end. Really tasty beer!

Pint on tap at the bridge. Cloudy yellow pour with nice white head. Aroma is super juicy, creamsicle orange aroma. Taste is super juicy, delicious. Palate is med bodied, creamy with light carbonation. Awesome.

Bottle from Meditrina. Hazy golden with head and lace. Wicked fresh grapefruity lemon grassy floral aroma. Light apricot tropical fruit grassy malt sweetness with dry grapefruity lemon floral finish with a touch of fruity tartness. Medium light body soft very fine carbo accentuates hops and blends flavor. Yeah, this is FUCKIN EXCELLENT!

Tap while in charleston. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Huge trop fruit piney aroma - mango, passion fruit papaya. Medium body, medium carbonation. Juicy with tangerine, mango, lime - there's pine, lightly toasted bread, grapefruit... very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

So good! Cloudy straw color, white head. Bright crisp arms of grass and citrus. Taste follows suit with citrus and bread with a pleasant mild/medium bitter finish. Very interesting palate with a juicy body with a slight dry finish. I could drink this every day.

Bottle. Pours a bright gold color. Taste is hoppy, flavorful and easy drinking . Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet dank fruit aroma, juicy wet hops. Tangerine, lemon and pine, ends with delicious bitterness and a long finish. More flavorful then most pales.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Pours hazy yellow orange, white head. Aroma is funky yeast, orange, tangerine, grass, straw. Flavor is milky fruits, lactose, citrus, yeast, grain, bread, dank.

En recevant cette bière ce midi au Farmhouse de Burlington, je racontais à mes convives que si la brasserie Lagunita était établie dans ma ville, je boirai beaucoup plus de produits locaux que je le fais actuellement. Rien de cette brasserie ne ma jusqualors déplu et cette bière ne fait pas exception à cette règle; bien au cintraire. Pendant toute la dégustation, des arômes évolutifs qui démarrent par une écorce de pamplemousse fraîche fendue à la main au-dessus de laquelle je perche mon grand nez fouineur pour en respirer les éclaboussures dhuile qui en jiclent dans une fine bruine fraîche et astringente pour les narines. Par la suite, mon nez et ma bouche se partagent des souvenirs de fruits frais, de malts doux, de houblins à la fois fruités et herbacés, de fleurs. Amertume délicate, saveurs percutantes. Un pur délice. Je remercie le Farmhouse pour srrvir de telles bières ridiculement trop froides, sans quoi je les engloutierais ridiculement trop rapidement.

Bottle into a snifter showing well filtered orange with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows an intense mix of mango, pineapple, cannabis, and blood oranges. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately to well carbonated. Strong flavors of blood oranges and tangerines supported on a clean bready backbone. Light to moderate bitterness on the finish. Very west coast style APA.
Pours pale yellow with white lacing. Aroma is bright citrus, resin, lemon and grass.

Pours cloudy golden with sticky white cap that laces nicely. Aroma is a mix of floral, pine, and citrus rind with a hint of malt. Flavor is outrageously good - a blast of pine bitter in the beginning immediately gives way to citrus notes which in turn give way to a slight malt sweet. At no time is there any harshness or bracing. The finish is clean and just a hint of sweet lingers. Phenomenal.
Really hoppy, hazy, grassy and big. Tropical fruit nose, lemon and fresh-cut grass. Pretty intense on the palate.
Pours hazy orange. Aroma it bright orange pineapple mango. Large citrus, not too bitter excellent palate clean finish. Very nice!

Very cloudy golden yellow color with small foamy head. Very luscious citrus aroma. Taste - lemon, lime, tropical fruit and a touch of pine resin. Also some faint floral and bubblegum notes. Long bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel. Nice but was hoping for more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma and appearance are unbeatable! I love unfiltered brews. Flavor is wonderful blend of malt and hops. Alcohol not evident.

Six pack of bottles from Whole Foods Santa Barbara. The bottle says "borned 10-17-16" which is a week ago!! Pours a very slightly hazy dark golden color with nice cream colored head. Very fresh hop aroma on opening, not the most fragrant, but nice. My personal opinion. This is the best commercially available fresh hop offering on the market. I thought so last year and I think this year's version of born yesterday is even better. The green hops are upfront, the ABV of 7.0 makes me question the ability to call this a pale ale, but I ain't complaining. A wonderful offering that makes life worth living.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Last Drop, Seattle. Creamy foam, hazy orange body. Nice, big, clean fresh hops start to finish. Juicy, very tasty. Bitterness is clean and refreshing. Very smooth body. Quite nice.
On tap at Draft Taproom. Big juicy, citrusy aromas, peach, pineapple, mango. Hazy yellow with a fully lasting white head. Pretty dry, very balanced, very juicy. Light-medium bodied.

Pours cloudy peach color with white head. Potent dank hop aroma with pineapple and grapefruit. Big juicy grapefruit flavor with some pineapple. Bitter fresh grapefruit finish. Really nice fresh brew. One thing that would be nice though is if the date was somewhere on the bottle showing what day "yesterday" was.

Pours hazy and light golden with tight head. Aroma of grapefruit rind and cat piss. Taste is resinous and fruity with lots of weed and citrus. Mouthfeel is slippery and smooth lemon and grapefruit juice. Best pale ale I have had. Nice fresh hop rendition. Hop head version of a shandy.

Tap at drafthouse. Soapy, citrus aroma. Taste is grapefruit, funk lemon, soap. Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thin white head. Strong aroma of juicy citrus and some pine. Medium bitter taste of citrus rind. Fairly smooth finish with lingering flavors. Not as good as I expected but not bad. OK. I gave it another chance and really started to like it even more. Its not as harsh or bitter as some similar style beers which is why I went back to try it again. I enjoyed it much more than the first time I tried it. Increased my rating from 3.4 to 3.7. Will definitely go back for more. Pretty enjoyable after all.
Tap at new bohemia ne. With commonmac and samadouche. Hazy gold yellow orange. Good head and lacing. Very fresh, citrus hop bite, full body. Tastes like a northeast ipa. Excellent.

Tap at New Bohemia on a beautiful fall day in Mpls. Juicy, unfiltered appearance. Deep golden with a smallish white head. 10 oz tulip pour. Nose is vibrant hops with heavy citrus and pine notes. Taste is really enjoyable. Plenty of juicy citrus with some elements of pineapple, grapefruit, lemon. Hop bitterness is present but not overwhelming. Mouthfeel has bite and a resinous quality that enhances the consumption experience. This is fresh and delicious. Reminds me of East Coast double IPAs. I wasnt born yesterday....this is great.
Pours an unfiltered, cloudy gold. Aroma big, fresh citrus and floral hops. Ripe fruits. Grapefruit, peaches, cereal grains, some grassiness, resinous mouthfeel. Excellent beer.
From a bottle at Dominion Wine and Beer. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Herbal and citrus nose. Grapefruit and pineapple taste with some nice maltiness. Moderately bitter finish.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a foamy, off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of grapefruit, orange, bread, pine, light dank, spice, biscuit and floral notes. Flavor is grapefruit, orange, bread, pine, light floral notes, biscuit, and spice - light a white pepper taste. Light plus bodied, crisp with a bone dry finish.

Bottle to glass. Pour is super hazy gold with a large white head. Nice. Aroma is juicy, citrusy hop for days with orange and pineapple dominating. A pleasing fruity sweetness on the nose too. Flavor is right in line with nose: juicy and citrusy with more orange and pineapple and mango. Light sweet malt. Really really good. I have been lucky enough to have a lot of tree house and trillium lately and this stands up to those in my opinion. Really impressed.
Bottle from brad...2016 version...resin hops on nose...mouth is citrusy hops...really fresh taste...really nice

2016 version. Pours just like some Sunny D. Nose of rich passionfruit, floral peach, ripe pink grapefruit, candied lemon, and cereal malt. Flavor is passionfruit, lemon, yellow apple, hop resin, cotton candy grape, grapefruit and bergamot. This years is like 12th of Never on steroids! Great release.

From a bottle dated 10-17-16. That means it was bottled two days ago...fresh is an understatement. This beer is outstanding with a bright and fresh hop flavor. Looking forward to the next five brews. Nice work, Lagunitas!

Pours a hazy golden glow. Fluffy white head. Strong aroma of mango, orange and grapefruit. Taste is orange juice, light malts, and light bitterness. Dry finish. No detection of alcohol. Very good beer.

A no-doubter here. Just picked this up with a bottled-on date of 10-17-16 meaning it was literally born yesterday! Poured from a 12oz bottle into a large wine glass the appearance is a radiant, yet slightly hazy, golden-orange. The head is a lush pillow of clean white foam reahcing around two fingers. The aroma on this is about as dank as it gets. Stone Enjoy By dank, but dare I say fresher than Stone!?! Anyhow, fresh grapefruti and orange explode up the nostrils with a sweet cereal and honey blossom undertone and a nice buzzsaw fresh pine character cutting through. On the tasting the aroma profiles are just further emphasized on big, bold and fresh the citrus twang carries a note. The finish is a hopheads wet dream with a puckering piney dryness. A world-class pale ale and possibly Lagunitas best all-around invention.
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of grapefruit, hops, malt, and straw. The flavor sweet with notes of grapefruit, hops, and straw, leading to a bitter finsh
Draft at slaters. Aroma of citrus hop and malt. Fresh taste of hop, orange zest, citrus and mild pine. Very good.

On tap at Shamrocks.. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with a nice head and good of lacing. Floral aroma of hops, tropical fruit and quite herbal. Taste of citrus, tropical fruit and subtle malt sweetness. Nice bitterness and a clean finish. Moderate body, crisp, clean and refreshing. Very satisfying.

On tap at the Brotherhood of Thieves. Yellow pour with a white head. Florally hop bouquet. Taste follows suit with a bit of pine/resin. Nicely balanced with some malty backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel. A pretty solid Pale Ale.
Pours golden with a nice head, aroma of of litchi, orange, slightly bitter, litchi, mango and tangerine, lemon skin, medium bodied. Very nice.

Draft, Thirsty Moose, Manchester, NH location. The aroma is just awesome, fresh floral hops mixed with grassy Mosaic. Tempting nose. 

The citrus, floral and grassy hops play really nicely here. The mouthfeel is soft and delicate. I order an entire pint of this. And these days that says a lot, when I want to drink more than a sample of anything!
On tap at TJs. Poured a golden color with an averaged sized head. Citrus hops with some floralness. Lighter sweet fuitiness in the finish.

Sample, brown bottle, 12-ounce, Christmas gathering at Stephen Morriss, savoured on December 18 2015; eye: golden, clear, ring of tan head, light lacing; nose: resinous hops, orange, green, light malt; mouth: resinous hops, orange, green, light malt, semi-dry and a bit thin finale in hops with light presence of malt, medium body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille brune, 12 onces, party de Noël chez Stephen Morris, savourée le 18 décembre 2015; il : dorée, limpide, anneau de mousse fauve, légère dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, orange, vert, léger malt; bouche : houblon résineux, orange, vert, léger malt, finale semi-sèche un peu mince en houblon avec légère présence de malt, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Draft at Kaseys Tavern in Chicago. Funky grainy aroma. Smells like skunky, dank, wet hops, maybe even a bit of horseblanket. Grainy, course, corny malt profile. Oily wet hops. Truly a great wet hop ale. Tastes as fresh as it gets. Dry firm finish, with a bit of slate minerality.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and light pine flavor. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and light pine linger.

What a great new offering from lagunitas, great beer with a decent kick, solid all the way

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice golden yellow color. Aroma is big piney hops with some floral and fruit. Flavor of a classic pale, mildly sweet malt action followed by great hop flavor bite, smooth throughout and a great finish.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Medium yellow brew with white head. Nice aroma of floral hops, cirrus, a little pine and tropical fruit. Taste is soft sweet maltiness up front, emerging light resin in the middle with a crisp citrus finish. Really good.

Bottle. Pours golden with a thin white head that left spotty lacing. Aroma of citrus, pine, grapefruit and had floral notes. Flavor was hoppy and bitter with pine, grapefruit, citrus, grass, floral hops, light caramel and notes of orange.

Bottle at home. Clear amber with a big white head. Aroma of orange peel citrus oil and a little papaya. Tastes fresh and bitter, a little bit yeasty and lots of citrusy hops. Medium body, lots of carbonation, mild citrus and tangy finish. Fun.

Had it fresh from a growler.

L: Fluffy big, off-white head. Body golden. Honey golden. 

S: Extremely juicy with citrus, citrus, honeydew and huge floral notes. Just amazing. 

T: Citrusy overall. Lots of orangy peel. Again, fresh honeydew. Amazing. Not so piney. 

A: Slight bitterness builds up after drinking. Very subtle and nice.

F: Very good mouthfeel. Very moderately carbonated, which felt really nice. Medium to Light-bodied.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverHazy blond color, compact head. Tropical fruit aroma; dry mouthfeel, crackery malts, then tropical fruits with a bit of hop resins.Balanced and clean, fresh.
This is just what you want from a Pale Ale!
On tap. Pours gold with light head. Aromas of pineapple, pine, and citrus. Flavors follow same with clean malts and fruity citrus. Great balance for a hop centric beer. Nicely done

On tap at St. Augustines, pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of piney hops, biscuity malt and some citrus. Flavour is super fresh, with loads of piney hops upfront, followed by citrus and just enough biscuity malt. Impeccably balanced with loads of hops, approaching IPA territory. Excellent.

Rated on 02-21-2016 (Bottle) The appearance of this beer is a medium sized off-white head that is mostly lasting, transparent bright yellow body, very fizzy, lively carbonation observed, and a fair amount of lacing adorns the glass. The aroma presents citrus, pine hops, fruity, very floral, grapefruit, grassy, bitter hops, orange peel, earthy, peach, fresh hops, and bready malt. The flavor presents moderate bitterness, citrus, pine hops, semi-sweet, fruity, grapefruit, floral, caramel, some orange peel, and it has a semi-dry finish. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation and this beer is medium-full bodied. Wow!! I am in need of a very good tasting beer and I made a superb choice if I must say so myself! This is one awesome APA in my opinion. It is very crisp and refreshing and quite bitter and hoppy tasting in a good way. The aroma and flavor are excellent and this is a beer that I definitely recommend and definitely a beer that I will drink again. More please!! Thanks Lagunitas for yet another good beer!!

Bottle. Hazy orange golden with a stable creamy head. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, guava, pineapple and citrus. Sweetish, fruity juicy hops flavors, light maltiness, nice balancing bitterness, semi-dry finish. Medium-bodied, smooth and enjoyable. Good one.

Bottle. Thanks zvsn. Cloudy orange with small off-white head. Very fruity aroma with lots of mango and citrus. Fruity flavor with notes of tropical (mostly mango), citrus, a bit grassy and creamy, sweetish and bitter. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

Draft @ Metro, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy weak grassy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy grassy finish.

Bottle at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share. Stanky Mosaic like hops, dank, grapefruit rind, tropical fruits. Pale gold color with lace. Very dank and green flavor with some citrus and tropical fruits. Decent, but not convincing.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 BJCP CATEGORY 18B: AMERICAN PALE ALE
AROMA: Strong hop aroma. Citrus and grass. Lemon lollipop (oxidized?). Not much malt presence. 9/12APPEARANCE: Cloudy orange. Large foam. Good retention. 3/3FLAVOR: Very bitter for style (probably too bitter for style). Strong grassy hops. Some spiciness. Moderate caramel/honey flavor. Could pass for an IPA. 13/20 MOUTHFEEL: Medium+ body. Lingering bitterness. Doesnt finish clean as guideline indicates. 3/5 OVERALL IMPRESSION: Very hoppy. Good taste. Seems oxidized or heat damaged. Tasty, but better classified as IPA. 7/10 TOTAL SCORE: 35/50
Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear golden, medium white head. Intense fruity, floral and grassy hop sa roma. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness. Great stuff.
Howler fill shared with friends. Talk about bright fresh citrus hops, pine as well. The taste is wonderfully balanced with some caramel malt coming through.

12 oz bottle from Dutchs at home from notes. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have an explosion of hops, citrus, pine, earthy, and floral, pale malts, a splash of caramel, lightly toasted, solid APA.

Bottle opened up at the 2015 Ottawa Year-end celebration. Clear light copper pour with an off white head that mostly settles down to a thin film. Was refreshing to snouff with a nice floral and grass hop presence, some light hay and gentle citrus which balances very well. Flavour doesnt quite come through on the palate, although having this right after Rare 2.0 might have been unfair, just found this to fade too much towards the end, although a moderate body and carbonation with a slight bitterness and fairly dry finish helped.

Draught @ Albion. Clear bright orange with small foamy off-white head, floral hops aroma, medium carbonation, citrus peel flavor, slightly sweet taste with little bitterness, medium bitter finish. Very smooth and balanced.

12/10/15. On tap at World of Beer, Destin. Missed this locally, was glad to find it. Orange pour with a nice khaki head, good lacing. Good aroma, dank hoppiness, citrus, not a lot of maltiness or caramel mucking it up. Awesome flavor, fresh hop character all over the place, dank, tropical fruits, citrus. Awesome stuff. Miles ahead of their regular pale ale, in fact. Delish!

Appearance: clear deep gold with two fingers of fluffy white head, excellent retention and lacing. (5/5) Aroma: bright citrus, tropical fruit, pine resin, onion, pale malt. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, strong bitter. (8/10) Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry lingering bitter finish. (4/5)

Well, it wasnt born yesterday, but they told me it was born in December when they filled the growler, so thats close enough. I was initially really excited by this, but the onion note just keeps growing and growing and growing The video on Lagunitas web site admits to Equinox, Mosaic, Amarillo, Simcoe, and Citra, but Im not sure which one is the onion/garlic culprit - usually its Summit, but that doesnt appear to be present in this one. Regardless, theres a definite onion/garlic character. Dont get me wrong, its still a world-class beer, but its not quite the paragon I initially thought it might be. (And can anyone explain to be how a 6.5%, 65-ish IBU pale qualifies as an APA and not an IPA? Anyone? Anyone? Bueller?) (16/20)

Taster. Pale yellow gold with creamy white head. Mild floral and tropical fruit... Solid malt backbone with lively floral pine and citrus note... Outstanding pale ale...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear gold with a nice even head. Aroma fruity and floral, with some nice tropical notes. Taste has a tone of tropical fruit as well, papaya, mango, and some things I cant quite name but that you can imagine grow on tropical islands :). Very very nice IPA
Clear orange gold with a minimal white head. Lots of bright citrus, orange, resinous pine. Quite bitter, some sweet honey notes. Medium body, long finish, quite acidic. Excellent.
Excellent pale ale. Creamy head with decent lacing. Tropical and citrus hop flavours. Has a nice grassiness and some zest.

At a tasting, thanks, quite clear deep yellow to orange color, aroma of pomello and fresh green vgeetables with some pine in the back, fruity shrubby flavor with a malty backbone and a mellow bitterness. Very nice.
Lemon characteristic hoppy ale on tap at fate brewing north. Very good and not overwhelming hoppiness, making it a west coast pale.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Maxs place. 2015 bottle. Golden. Aroma of nice "green" piney and fruity hops, slightly oniony, and some malt. Flavor has sweetish malt, and nice "green" piney and fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Good.

(bottle - 12 oz) Clear orange/gold pour with a puffy white head. Fruity and zesty hop aroma with a bit of dankness underneath. Flavor has a nice tangy hop bite with a mild sweet fruityness under it all. Really smooth and leaves a nice aftertaste. [11/28/15]
Bottle from local liquor store. Deep golden color, white head. Very fresh and fruity nose. Malty and hoppy body, super fresh.

Cloudy golden pour with a single finger head. Aroma of mango and that classic "dankness" Lagunitas is known for. A little passion fruit as well. Light bodied. Lots of passion fruit and tons of mango. The fruitiness really pops. Juicy at first, but finishes dry. Lots of lace.
Clear, pale. Assertive AIPA aroma, a little katty and resinous. Abrasive citrus pith, too sweet and syrupy. Viscous. On tap, Just Tapd, Warner Robins.

[Bottle (12oz)] Pours a slightly hazy gold with an average size long-lasting frothy white head. Minimal lacing. Nice aroma (7+) of fresh hops, tropical fruit, citrus, pine and sweet malt. Flavour follows (7+) and is also nice, along with a long, somewhat big bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Pleasant and enjoyable.

sample from draft in goteborg sweden, poured a nice golden colour with a good white head. aroma of fresh crisp malts, grapefruit, citrus, mango, and sweet peach notes. grains, pine needles, resins, nice dry citrus flavor. nice crisp mouthfeel. lovely pale!

Clear golden color with off-white head. Aroma is intensely hoppy, mostly grassy and floral. Taste follows, a bit malty at first with grassy, floral, slightly piney hops. Very west coast style hop profile. Body is medium, soft and well carbonated. Overall its a really good pale ale, indeed one of the best I had.

Pint on tap at Beer Revolution in Edmonton served in a 16oz pint glass pours a clear golden color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus with some mild cereal grains. Taste is a bold citrus hop bitterness with a caramel malty sweetness. Grainy mouth feel. Light to medium body with good carbonation. Overall, a very well balanced and full flavored pale ale. Recommended.

On tap at beer revolution...for a fresh hop pale ale this one plays out well and I can only imagine if one was able to get it at the source. Taste is fresh squeezed citrus hops with a great pungent Aroma... Could easily drink many of these!

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of green grassy hops with nice floral undertones is quite exquisite. Taste is a nice mix of green grassy notes with some floral undertones and some light residual sugar notes with very faint bitterness. Body is about average with good carbonation. Solid APA with quite the hops flavours.

Juicy aroma of peach, nectarine, mango, passionfruit, spruce, a bit grassy on the end. Taste of straight up hops, simcoe/citra dominant with a grapefruit, mango and overripe apricot. This is really good, lacking the mouthfeel and the general lack of bitterness that the east coast has.
Had this a few months back. Amber pour, clear with a nice white head. From my notes: really hoppy and delicious. Cool concept, glad to see it done on such a large scale!

Absolutely fantastic. Übēr frèh. Not a soft brew. Apricots and orange and hard ass pine, caramel, a bit resiny, pineapple, dank. Highly distracted by how awesome this is and the chick with the low cut shirt sitting across from me. Ok, its pretty much all the chick.

I was so lucky to be at the store the day this was delivered,, even luckier cause the owner said he was shocked he got any more of it.. this beer has the floral grassy taste i search for but hardly ever find.. If anyone knows of a ipa that is available that taste like this please let me know i can wait till the fall for it to come back.. A little something has some of that taste if fresh, but not like the born yesterday

Draught @ Steampunk Bar. Pours clear golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is fruity and tiny grassy with caramel, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, lychee, moist grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is sweet, bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is crisp, round, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and bittr with crackers, caramel, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, lychee, moist grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Bit sweet but nicely fresh and fruity. Rare to see US beers this fresh here.

On draught at Local Cantina Creekside. The beer pours a hazy golden color with a medium off-white head that dissipates steadily to a film. Stringy lacing on the glass. Citrus, hops and malt in the nose. Medium-bodied with flavors of floral hops, grapefruit and toasted malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
The best Pale ale Ive ever tasted. Fresh crispness hits your nose then the wonderfully balanced taste flows over your tongue leaving a tingling aftertaste.
On tap at O'Connors. Golden with dense white head. Aroma hoppy, pine, resin, pale malt and light yeast. Taste is malty, hoppy, light caramel, a bit minerals, fruit with medium bitterness.

Lovely golden color. Big frothy white head. Hot damn the nose is amazing. Very punchy hops of mandarin oranges, lemons, resiny notes with some faint pine. Medium full body mouth with modestly aggressive carbonation. The maltniess rolls across your tongue, while citrus notes attack your palate. Modestly dry. Nice moderate bitter finish. WOW, this is really amazing. Absolutely stunning.
Overall: Bread, caramel, orange oil, pine, bitter citric peel.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. (Vintage 2015) Reviewed 2015-12-25.

Bottle at 2015 xmas gathering. Pours clear yellow some head and lots of lacing. Nose is citrus and grainy. Flavours of citrus, pine, grapefruit and cereal. Taste medium bitter, light sweet. Light body with lively carbonation.
I split a 6 pack of this with a friend. Nice piney aroma but not overbearing. Medium bitterness, light medium body. Excellent.

Clear pale orange, with a good looking white head and visible carbonation. Smells, as my girlfriend described it, like a meadow. Floral hops, citrus, honey, caramel. It tastes of citrus and piney hops, a bit dank, bitter and salty and super refreshing. Highly drinkable, definitely one of the beers I would enjoy on a sunny summer afternoon, if I could find it in Europe.

Bottle, shipped across the country by Michael -- cheers buddy! Im sure that this is even better when truly fresh, but even a month or two later its an excellent beer. Right away it opens up with an all-hop aroma of oranges, tropical fruit, and waves of dank, and the flavor follows on from there. I noticed a distinct "hop pellet" taste at the very end, which Ive spotted before in wet hop beers; thats not exactly my favorite flavor (to bitter), but it was pretty light and I imagine a lot of people drinking this will find it a positive characteristic.
Bottle thanks to my friend Chris "The King": Poured a golden with white head. Aroma was strong dank hops. Taste was resin hops very dank and earthy. Fresh is the best for sure!
Aromas of fresh hops and fresh citrus bite. Light foamy white head and golden orange body. Fresh wet hop flavors with a sharp citrus zest. Crisp on the palate.

bottle. Golden with one finger head. Theres enough hops here to push it into IPA territory. Fairly light body with huge punchy hops. Crisp bitterness. Fantastic hop flavors with citrus, tropical and light pine.

Pours a chill hazed golden orange on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of citrus hop notes, dank and resinous. Taste follows, not as resinous and fresh as I would want. Medium bitterness, good carbonation, solid but not exciting.

Bottle Hazy light orange soapy blocky off white head. Very strong up front fresh hop aroma. Sweet resinous and fruity citrus. More pungent and bitter in the flavors. Some tropical fruit malt sweetness. Bitter trailer. Pretty bold for a pale

A lightly hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, pungent floral hops, citrus pulp, lemon pulp, light tropical fruits, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with citrusy floral hops, grapefruit pulp, nice and smooth. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2015.

Oh my. May be one of the best smelling ipa or pale ales ever. Tons of papaya, passion fruit, pineapple and mango with light toasted malts and a light dank profile. Super fresh and well balanced with a moderate bitterness. So fruity and fresh

Keg at Beer Run. Hazy golden amber, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of big citrus notes, mango, caramel, toasted malt. The taste is bright grapefruit, lemon, lime, papaya, pale malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness.
Golden pour with a white soapy head. Aroma is amazing fresh, juicy hops, but not overdone. Clean fresh taste and just a touch sweet.

Draught at Steampunk Bar, Göteborg. Clear golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy citrus aroma, pine, peach, mango, grapes, some caramel. Hoppy pine flavor, citrus, peach notes, passion fruit, grassy notes, some caramel. Fresh with alcohol well hidden.

Geezaloo this stuff is Great
I got really really lucky to find this at Raleys in a discount basket for 5.99 for a sixpack. They only had two, and I only took one to "try it" Wish I got both of them.
Now I cant find it anywhere
Poured nice amber with decent head and lacing.
Nice fruity nose and foretaste and good carbonation finishing with a slight hop kick. Absolutely one of the best offerings from Lagunitas 
If you are blessed enough to find this anywhere grab all you can. You will never be sorry you did.

on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear bright medium amber color, white head, sheets of lace. Taste is caramel malt that grows significantly as it moves through the swallow to unsweetened tea and solid hops. The whole thing coasts through a long satisfying finish. Big, complex, balanced, well done!

Refrigerated 12 oz. squat brown bottle poured into a glass. Slightly hazy deep golden with small white head. Aroma is nice floral his, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is floral hops, descent malt backbone, and bitter finish.
Fresh Hopped Pale ale was super tasty and flavorful. Terrific Pale aroma and flavors and the added hops make this a great easy drinking beer.
Pours clear amber with white head. Smell is pine, tropical fruit and citrus. Taste is pine, citrus, mango and tropical fruit. Very crisp. Light body and light carb.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, grapefruit, taste is juicy fruit, sweet toffee.

Bottle from Brewers Haven. Nice fresh hop ale from this brewery. Big fruity citrus notes abound in both aroma and taste. Pours out a medium gold with medium fluffy head. Finishes with tons of citrus, pineapple, grapefruit. Tasty stuff.

Keg @The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh. Pours golden big white head. Nose is big grapefruit, mango, citrus, slight pine, slight resin also quite odd ever so slight strawberry. taste is caramel, toffee, citrus fruits, slight resin a touch of sweetness from the malts. Wonderfully balanced with a long lasting grapefruit finish.
Keg at The Bat. Clear golden. Fresh fruity aroma, exotic fruits, mango. Taste is tangerin, orange, exotic fruits, grapefruity bitterness, quite fizzy.
Keg at the hanging bat... Golden amber.. Thin white lacing.... Light zezty peppery orange fruits nose... Little over fizzy.. Juicy peppery fruits.. Juicy orange.. Soft light floral body

$10.99 six pack (point number one in this beers favor). This is some serious stuff, and certainly not an APA at 7.5 %. Tropical fruit, stone fruit, bitter, dry, clean on the finish. Damn good, one of the better affordable hoppy beers Ive had this year. Dont give a lick that Heineken owns them, this is worth buying in almost every context.

Bottled shared at dbarnolds, 10/31/15. First off, I like the concept even if it is a bit gimmicky. Nice fresh hop aroma, some grapefruit and pine. Enjoyable hop bitterness. Drinks really nicely. A tasty overall beer and a fun gimmick too!

Bottle. Hoppy, pale. Tropical. Juicy and dry. Bitter. Pretty damn good. All
You critics can duck sick

Clear bright orange with a one-finger white head and ok lace. Big grapefruit aromas dominate, with notes of citrus rind, pine, floral hops and toast. Flavor is similar, as grapefruit dominates throughout with brief appearances by resinous pine and toasted malt. Light body, bright carbonation, sticky mouthfeel and a crisp finish.

Bottle.  "Borned":  10/26/15.  Mine says 6.5% ABV.  A slightly hazy amber pour with a smallish beige head.  The aroma features lots of rich grapefruits, zesty citrus rinds, apricots, pineapples, resiny pine, and some caramel maltiness.  Goes down thin to medium-bodied.  A touch of caramel and some grains upfront in the taste.  Resiny.  Grapefruits, pineapples, and plenty of zesty citrus rinds finish things off with a moderate bitterness that lingers.  Ive been drinking a case of this since October 28th, and I think this is actually a little tastier with some age to it.

Draft to pint. Looks good; a transparent golden orange with off-white head and steady carbonation. Smells of juicy, piney, and grassy hops with a well-balanced moderately bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Some bitter hops as well. Enjoyable.

Pours clear gold into a tulip. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Garlic and mint aromas. Medium bodied with sweet garlic and resin upfront turning dry in the lasting pine finish.

A bright amber body offers very subtle haze beneath two inches of fading bright white head leading to dots and thin peninsulas of lace all around

Juicy, mellow tropical fruit is accented with sharp, spicy herbal dankness, an overall sense of pineapple rind and flesh, subtle white grape characteristics, melon nuances... all on a cohesive medium body with mild, rounded carbonation leading to residuals of the previously mentioned components... a crushable, balanced, juicy brew

12oz bottled 10/28/2015 served at 45-50º into Orrefors Difference Pils glass

Pours a pale straw yellow color with a white head full of weirdly big bubbles. A small citrus nose but not much aroma. Solid fruit based citrus with a dry feel on the tongue. A sugar wheaty note that makes this one a little different. Really good.

Honey malt, tangerine, peach, tropical fruits; hazy golden color with a fluffy head of lasting off white head, fine sediment in suspension; great showcase of Mosaic hops... Grassy, pine, floral, and tangerine hops, soft fleshy fruit (peach, papaya, passion fruit), light underlying toasted toffee maltiness, even bitterness throughout that is smooth and not overwhelming; medium body, slick mouthfeel; really great fresh hop pale ale, I love Mosaic hops and this beer uses them very nicely, a hard beer to find, but definitely worth it!

Tap at 83 proof. Mid orange coloured pour with a lasting sticky white head. Aroma is lovely fresh hop, orange rind, citrus, zesty, slightly floral hop. Flavour is composed of solid vase Malts, light biscuit, sticky orange rind, piney hop. Really fresh hop character. Palate is medium bodied, slightly sticky hop, highish carbonation. Really good.

Bronzed body, diffuse head. Sharply Chinook-like bitter hop aroma that is a tad buzzy with the hum of cat urine--perhaps Simcoe. Nicely bitter body, but well balanced. There is also some enjoyable hop spicyness on the palate and a touch of saltiness which impart a delightful complexity. Tasty and sessionable.
12oz bottle pours a clear gold with a white head. pine grapefruit and orange taste.

It pours golden with a large, slightly off white head. It is clear with no clouding at all and a good deal of lace. It has aromas of grapefruit and pine with hints or caramel that become more prominent as it warms. It has grapefruit and citrus flavors with pine and and hints of caramel. It feels moderately light and easy to drink with a bitter finish.

Pours mostly clear orange gold with large cream-colored head. Aroma is big floral hops and tropical fruit and taste follows perfectly. Very floral and tropical with nice bitter finish. Light to medium feel and carbonation. A bit lighter version of the best West Coast IPAs. Delicious!

Tasted from bottle. Pours a slightly hazy gold with thick white head. Great lacing. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruit with some pins. Taste is moderate to heavily bitter with a nice malt backbone. Flavors of grapefruit, mango, papaya, passion fruit, crackers, pine. Excellent pale ale. Love the west coast style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden orange color with a small foamy off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, tangerine, and green onions. Taste is sweet orange, tangerine, grapefruit, caramel malt, green onion, light cat piss and grass.

Gorgeous pour, soft golden blonde with one finger of white head. Nose is fantastic, bright citrus and tropical fruit, mandarin orange, garlic, fruit skins, woody notes, and green. Flavor is citrus rind forward with woody/garlic on the back and a spicy hop bitterness. Medium light bodied

Smells fantastic. Pours a murky golden color with a head that leaves a lace down the glass. Very piney to match the smell with just the right amount of bitterness. You get a citrus kick to help balance everything thing out. Outstanding beer!!!

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear gold color with a white head that settles to a film leaving some nice lacing. Aroma is amazing: a very fresh hop aroma strong with citrus being the strongest. Medium body, good balance of malt and hops, the juicy citrus comes along for the ride. Finish is more of the same citrus hops. Amazing!

Bottle. Pours out an attractive golden color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is Aroma is of oily hops, citrus, some resin, grapefruit and light grainy malt. Taste is solid, oily resiny hops, bitter citrus, light grass and a touch of grains. Good lingering bitterness.

Clear lemon gold with good head and moderate carbonation. Sweet malts, piney peachy hops, dry finish. Bugger me this is good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 Hazy gold, dense lace. Medium body, assertive flavor, spritzy but silky mouthfeel with high carbonation, moderate heat, lingering palate, clean, bitter but very flavorful finish. Bitter, off-dry, quite balanced. Fruity, hop flavor dominates, citrusy, herbal. Big and assertive, enjoyable in moderate quantities. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Poured a clear golden yellow with foamy white head. Aromas of pine resin, citrus, and all around hoppy goodness. Flavor had more pine, grapefruit, lemon, and some tropical notes to it. Very hoppy and fresh. Medium body, sticky texture to it, lively carbonation, smooth finish. This was a good one and one Id drink daily if I could.

Bottle. Pours a golden clear pale with a large white head. Aroma of bright citrus orange and pineapple and sweet malt. Big flavors citrus(pineapple orange, tangerine) and pine. Light body with resinous bitter hop Now thats how a fresh hop beer should taste!

12oz bottle from Andersons in Dublin. Yellow gold with thin bright white. Aroma of fresh floral hop - nice. Tastes are honey, floral, onion, pine, light pepper spice. This is a strange - parts are better than the sum. I like it in theory I guess.
Deeply golden in color. Nice , white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, some bread and hint of malt. Crisp , refreshing taste with bitter, hoppy finish. Great , but can be easily confused with IPA.

Poured from a bottle. Ill have to admit my expectations were high for a big punch. Citrus quality was very good but not mind blowing for the hype. Still very good for comparisons in a very competitive market these days. Carmel hue with a nice healthy white head. I enjoy IPAs that have this nose and flavor with a dynamic hop profile that have a soft bitterness that is easy to drink like this.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Borned on 10/26/15. Pours golden, clear, big creamy head. Aroma is pine, resin, tropical fruits, big west coast dankness, orange, grapefruit, candied sweetness, mango, citrus heavy. Smells really fresh. Flavor is sweet candied orange, grapefruit, big hops, medium effervescence, big high alpha finish, kind of an oily hop feel. Solid finish overall, bitterness continues. Very good. 

Revisited in 2016 - unfiltered this time. Very creamy. Still phenomenal.
Fantastic brew! Fresh citrus hops, sweet grains, light caramel and a sweet herbal quality. Everything about this beer is crisp and fresh. Hints of pine in the dry finish.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and shaker served showing a clear & bright, golden tone, with a persistently frothy layer of soft white head foam, and sheet-like & wavy spray to the lacing. The nose was lightly dank, then some smooth breadiness to the malt, followed by citrusy grapefruit. Better than medium bodied, assisted by good carbonation, and some creamy texture to the mouthfeel, the taste added a moderate and balanced blend of bitterness notes as earthy, citrusy, and rind-like, tempered nicely by a silky malt content, and a bit of malt sweetness. A totally palate friendly, benchmark APA. Almost a year later at the same place. A shaker full with a little less clarity, a bit more dankness, noticeable spruce, and a touch of herbs in the aroma, and some pit fruit sweetness that partnered with the citrus.

Light on the citrus up front, but shows baked bread and toast notes above a blast of fresh hops that linger long. This is really a hops showcase. This is balanced and refreshing but lacking in terms of fruit. Very surprised by the abv here.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized to large, frothy, white, fully lasting.
Body is medium to dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (grain), moderately hoppy (grass, grapefruit, resin), with notes of plastic, cooked vegetables, sauteed onions.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter, unclean.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. 

Yuck! Wow, awful aroma with off notes galore. And the hops themselves are raw and generic smelling too. Made me literally grimace the first time I sniffed it (and say "ewww" out loud, no joke). Lots of onion odor. Vegetal and plastic too. Dirty in the aftertaste as well, unsurprisingly. Looks nice but otherwise its a total drain pour.
Bottle. It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of hops. The taste was of citrus fruits, pine resin and more hops. Awesome, not too much.
Purchased at Knightly Spirits in Orlando,Fl. Another winner from Lagunitas that has a fresh hoppy taste with a nice citrus backbone with just the right amount of sweetness in the finish.

orange gold pour. Big white foam. Aroma dank, onions quite cheesy here. Tastes orangy, big pollen/pond water thing going on here. gross. flavor identity of the hops is present in the aroma, but when tasted the typical lagunitas brown malt flavor blankets everything. An inferior fresh hop ale. Lagunitas is better off doing intense American Strong Ales. For real good fresh hop beers, drink real Washington State beer.

12 oz. bottle. Clear golden body with a nice white head. Smell is cracker and lightly toasted malt. Grassy hops behind it. Taste is resiny pine hops. Sweet caramel behind it. Bitterness from the hops and some toasted malt quickly stunt the sugars. Drinkable and pretty light tasting. Enjoyable, but I admit I was expecting something really remarkable from the reviews.

On tap at Örebro Ölcafé. Hoppy smell with a green aroma or smell of hop bag, also grassy with citrus. Hoppy taste with citrus and hop bag. Strong bitterness. A bit too young the green/hop bag aroma will settle down and hopefully leave a cleaner hop aroma.
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 Tap. A top notch IPA to be sure but the highest rated Lagunitas beer? Super well balanced and citrusy. Light bodied and delicous.
On tap at Dre's. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a bit of head. Dank hops. Bitterness lingers. Citrus.

Pours gold with white head and moderate lacing. Very small floaties. Aroma is fresh and juicy citrus and lemon peel. Taste is the same with dank and troub. Very bitter...numbs the tongue. Ill be buying this again for sure.

12 oz bottle. Pours a mostly clear golden color with some hop particulate floating around and topped by a small off white head of foam that settles in nicely to a thin film. The aroma is bursting with fresh hop notes of orange and grapefruit citrus, melon rind, dry floral notes, grass, and pine over a toasted bread malt base with nice bitterness on the backend. The flavor follows with the bright citrus notes of orange and grapefruit up front to go with pine, dried grass, pepper, and a dry toasted bread malt base. Ample bitterness from the fresh citrus and pine hops on the back end. Light in body, smooth and dry on the palate with good carbonation that leads to a drying and bitter sweet finish. Really well made pale ale with a really big fresh hop aroma and bitterness and a nice dry finish. Very crushable. Awesome stuff.

Picked up this gem last weekend... I hope the week in the fridge hasnt destroyed the wonderful lupulin party I was promised by the label. Clear golden with a good enough white head, but there are seriously a TON of protein floaties (that with a pro dexterity were kept mainly in the bottle).. No shit.. BUNCHES of coagulated particulate (weird, but never effects the nose and palate).. Fantastic citrus and tropical fruit party bowl of hoppiness in the aroma and the flavor... but not the expected bitterness that would come with an IPA.. Just a monstrously hop forward pale ale in unfamiliar ranks.. Few pale ales have packed this much up-front hoppiness and it is testament to the integrity of Lagunitas... Great beers for a great price and frequently incredible beers for a great price. MANY neckbeards would be overwhelming the geek forums if this was made by the "hyped brewery of the week"... Instead, much of the country can buy a 6er for $11ish. Props to the good folks in Petaluma.
Draft. Nice pale ale. Intense citrus hop flavor and aroma. Nice body. A bit of a carbonation bite.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
12 ounce bottle. Pours mostly clear, pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, tropical, pine, floral, and some malt. Very nice.

Very strong hop scents with a bit of citrus and something sweet. Brown golden color with little cloudiness. Very strong hop flavors right up front, with a bit of caramel or malt and some citrus on the back. A little more bitter than I would like but overall pretty good.

On Draught
Pours a pale golden color with a big head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is ridiculously dank, melony (like specifically musk melon) with some mild herbal character. Just all sorts of hop forward and aromatic. 

The flavor is again with the big hoppiness, not overly bitter... more towards the drier side of things and just a whole lot of orange, melon, & citrus zest. The malt character is really mild but also not employed to a mild degree. 

I dig it for sure.
Bottle. Gold with a huge soapy white head that leaves tons of lacing. Melon, grass, grapefruit and citrus rind. Light creamy mouthfeel. Awesome.

Bottle. Poured a clear copper color with an average to large frothy white head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex citrus hop aroma. Medium to abundant body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration.

very drinkable here, tons of strong hop aroma and flavor. Would totally make this a regular since the beer here is MEH. (Arizona) The only downside is that its too bitter. And its listed as a pale ale. Go figure.

Tap at Orebro Olcafé, Sweden. Pours a soft disappearing head, low to medium carboration. Fresh aromas (ambrosaic almost), smells of joyous autumn fun, pine, citrus and pear. Tastes of mango, slight resin, citrus and finishes with a subtle malt sweetness. It really is amazing how this beer was shipped halfway around and still tastes so incredibly fresh.

Poured a semi hazy golden to orange with a white head. Aroma was of big resinous and dank hops, light tropical notes too. Flavor on the dank side, no room for malt, bitterness kept to a minimum. Another really solid Hoppy lagunitas offering.

Poured a 12 oz at Lizardville. Somewhat cloudy orange-gold with ample head size. The aroma is big fruit with orange and grapefruit citrus, biscuit, some hints of pine, and pasture. The taste is very well balanced between the citrus notes, the fresh grass and pine, and the bread/malts. I really enjoyed every sip. Moderate carb and medium to light body. Pretty colour also. Very good pale ale. Tasted fresh.
12oz bottle. Clear brassy tone/moderate white foam. Low nose, but chock full of grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit, dried grass & light pepper flavor. Medium body and medium to full carbonation.
Draft. Clear golden color. Nice fresh meadow aroma. Taste is farmy, floral, tasty.
Poured from a coupla six packs of bottles, grapefruit and peel, a little tropical, some dry at the end really easy drinking.

Draft. Holy danky nose. Lots of tropical fruity notes as well, wet, coney hops. Pours very clear, pale yellow with a medium sized white head. Taste is initially aggressively hopped in the flavor and moderately to aggressive in bitterness. A seemingly non existant malt presence to the point of almost being a bit thin. A bit if pepper and alcohol as it warms. Overall the aroma is spot on but the mouthfeel seems to be a touch lacking with the alcohol being too noticeable.

Clear gold with a small white head that fades quickly to a ring but laces nicely. Nose is terrific with citrus and pine bursting out; grapefruit is dominant along with some light honey and floral notes as well as a touch of melon. Malt is just a passing note of light caramel sweetness before a big bitter grapefruit focus which doesnt quite live up to the promise of the nose. Mouth is slick and slightly thin with carbonation a little soft as well. Finish is long and bitter. Nice nose, shame about the face.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 Bottle. Clear gold with a white head. Resinous American hop aroma has notes of apricot, cantaloupe, pine sap, grassy hop pellets, light notes of green onion and garlic. Medium-light bodied, moderately sweet with relatively strong bitterness and moderate acidity. Kind of fishy / soapy, though the off-notes are mild. Body is a little limp and watery and the finish is fruit cocktail syrup, raw hop cones, limp carbonation, I understand that "big" hop aromas go far here, even if it does smell like garlic butter, but more confusing are high scores for something with such a terrible mouthfeel and finish. This is sub-average in every way IMHO [:32]

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine, Raleigh-North Hills (borned October 26, 2015). Dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Enticing aroma of pineapple, passion fruit, tangerine, and light caramel malt. Juicy hop taste of tropical fruits and light pine with a balanced, sweet malt finish. Great beer!

On tap at Central Flats & Taps. Yellow, with a thin but dense white head. Smells very citrusy, lots of grapefruit and mango. Nice. Taste is clean and crisp, with green, citrusy hops dominating. Some notes of stone, as well. Very tasty.

12 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled ("Borned") on 10/26/2015. Clear golden yellow/orange with a good amount of off-white head. Aromas of garlic, onions, grapefruit citrus, light floral notes. Tastes of grapefruit citrus, garlic and onions, floral notes, a little pine. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice pale.

12oz bottle, from Dutchs. Labeled 6.5%. Borned 10/26/15. Golden orange color, with lots of fine particles in the body. Thin white head, leaving great thicker lace. Awesome big, bright hoppy aroma, kind of piney, some citrus and resin. Kind of spicy hop character. Seeing the garlic that gendv mentioned. Bigger assertive bitter taste. Lighter sweet, more dry. Bigger body, kind of full feel. Soft, lighter to moderate carbonation. Just a mild rough edge to it, but overall, a pretty impressive wet hop pale ale.
Gold amber pour, thin white head. Heavy citrus aroma... if I didnt know any better, Id think this is an IPA. Smooth, crisp citrus on a medium body.

Bottle from the warehouse. Pours a yellow-orange with a white head. Nose is some light caramel, some grass, some lemon, citrus, and hints of dank. Flavor is huge hop presence- grassy and slightly pine with bits of lemon and some malt. Light in body and a delicious pale ale.

I had this like four days out and I didnt care for it,

But then I had this a few days later and the hoppy aroma

Would be Pliny, but the astringency on the aftertaste

12oz bottle pours out a golden topped with a nice head. Nose is great fresh hops melons caramel sweetness. Taste is amazing the fresh hop melon tropical fruit a nice malty balance. The end is a very well balanced sweet and bitter. This is very nice.

Pours a clear, golden with fluffy white head. The aroma is fantastic and is up there with the best IPAs. There is citrus, pine and a strong dankness along with some mellow sweetness. Taste is very pungent and resinous with some pine and a subtle sweetness. The bitterness is subdued. Light bodied and an overall solid offering that is crisp, refreshing and juicy. I will be picking up a case of this.
Pretty darn tasty pale. Clear bubbly golden. Aroma is rich boquetbof floral hops. Tastes adds a nice juicy citrus tasty. Mellow bitterness. Very clean and crisp. Medium bodied for a pale. Good stuff

Pours crystal clear and gold with a large white head. The resinous hop aromas hit you before you pick up the glass. Aroma is a beautiful blend of red grapefruit and heavy pine - wow, nice!! So far, this is hitting it on all levels and any hophead would love this. Taste is reminiscent of Palate Wrecker blended with a 2013 Hopslam. Bottle. Extremely fresh and dank hops of pine, grapefruit, and orange hit you as soon as the cap comes off. Big rich flavors sit perfectly in a refreshing, crisp, drinkable 6% sweet spot. A pale ale light body with IPA dankness

12 oz bottle. ABV says 6 something, not 7.5%. 2015 edition. Pours clear orange/yellow, smallish head, little lacing. Dank hop aroma, flavor. Quite drinkable, even though I plucked this beauty from the fridge a bit too soon. Clean finish. Highly quaffable at under 7%. Its not quite as "juicy" as other fresh hop ales, but it is still very good. The fresh hop taste and aroma isnt as strong as in others. Taste is citrus and pine without dank that I expected (especially from Lagunitas!). Still, its very good.

Aroma is absolutely perfect. Perfect mix of pine and citrus rind hops with a hint of malt mixed in. Good slightly see-through golden color with a bright white small head of foam. Taste is varied and amazing. A touch of sweetness right away followed by pure hop flavor. The hops are completely clean, not earthy or muddled in any way. Bitter yet not overpowering aftertaste. Still refreshing despite an abundance of hops. The palate and amount of carbonation is just right. Palate is dense for an IPA, more bubbly and light than you would find in a DIPA. This was great. Last year it was hard to find but now it is more readily available. That is a good thing. Try this now.

Wow. First off, pours a standard amber, somewhat honey colored, from a bottle, white head, good lacing. The aroma that hits you is like a handful of fresh hops, dank and musky, citrusy and floral. Flavor is pleasantly soapy, and again tastes like the freshest hops imaginable. Very easily drinkable, doesnt taste like its 7.5%. Personally Id like to have a hint of some residual malt; here it gets washed away with some bitterness, but that is a very minor request in terms of what this beer has to offer. The manager of the store where I bought it apologized that he received it last week and it had apparently been bottled a few days before, joking that it was already past its prime. Great beer.

Draft at Tap and Handle. Clear golden appearance with a lacy white head. Juicy, hoppy aroma with tropical fruit, citrus zest and light toasted grain. Similar flavor, juicy, fresh, dank and easy to drink. Average body. Refreshing and delicious overall.
Golden pour. Leafy, dank piney hops with mild citrus and some malt. More dank, vegetal, leafy hops. Pine and more pine. Golden malt. Nice.

This just in... a real hop bomb from Lagunitas. Not the freshest ever, as the local Tree House Julius is an unfiltered wet-hop soup served right out the door of the brewery, but this is a good one all the same. Citrusy hop aroma, full hop taste and not especially bitter, it has a golden lager color. Theres malt in here somewhere, but overwhelmed by the hops, the mix of which features a familiar (and enjoyable) Lagunitas flavor profile. Says here ABV 7.5%, but the bottle says 6.5%.
Bottle from craft ale house. Pours clear yellow with a medium sized white head. The aroma has is very fresh, piney, lemon. The taste has a hugely earthy, bitter, zesty lemon. Really nice and light.

12oz bottle from Brook Falls. Golden pour. Rings of lace. Aroma had huge fresh hops, burnt bacon. Taste is even better - hops and hops. Finishes long and well blended between bitter and sweet. Terrific hop forward brew. Happy to see from Lagunitas. 16.2

Poured from a 12oz brown bottle into Spieglau IPA glass, a mostly clear golden colour, a bit of chill haze to be expected from so much suspended hop matter, massive off-white foam, everlasting with sheet s of Belgian lace. Nice biscuity, slightly caramelly grainbill underneath. Light-medium body, strong carbonation, long-lasting hoppy aftertastes. Good stuff.

Bottle from Whole Foods PM. Pours hazy straw colored with off-white head. Nose is very fruity, with notes of honeydew, hops, berry, and florals. Bottle at Shamrock Pub! Clear straw with great white pillow of a head. Fresh floral grassy hop aroma that is not over powering. Green lime leaves and herbs. Subtle and complex. Grassy green dry finish. Well balanced complex. Drink fresh and enjoy!

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of floral and lightly citrusy/resinous hops, some pale malts, and some dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A solid pale ale, but pretty generic too and therefore its rated a little too high in my opinion.

On tap at Barrels and Bottles poured a clear tarnished gold with a small lasting ivory head. Aromas of bread, grassiness, orange zest, pink grapefruit and pine resin. tap at bottle bar east, pours Clearish orange gold with small to medium soapy white head. Nose is amazing with papaya, mango, grapefruit, and Granny Smith apple. Bottle. Slight chill haze golden orange. Tangerine, mango, cantaloupe, grass and some herb in the aroma. Flavor is more grassy herbal, but does have a tangelo note, and some slight bittersweet citrus qualities. Lighter to medium body thats slick.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2015 12oz bottle. Filtered tan-orange body. Big, foamy off-white head. Awesome juicy new school tangerine mango grapefruit aroma. Juicy hop flavors, a pleasant clean but rich golden malt backdrop. Really easy to drink. Pretty much nails it. Solid new school Pale Ale.

12 oz bottle. Clear brassy yellow with a clingy white head. Nose is mango, musk, orange peel and toffee. Juicy medium body with drippy resin and a buzz. Taste is dank bud, mango, lime and citrus pith. Dig this with some P-Funk; so fresh.
Golden color with a medium sized white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, pine resin. Taste of citrus, dank, light pine, tropical fruits, grapefruit.

Draft @ Brewers Haven. Pours a golden color with a tall white fluffy head. Aromatic with citrus and tropical fruit, a little pine. Sweet taste, moderate level of bitters. Sticky and wet, great impact from the heavy hop use. Very nice.

12 oz bottle, borned 10/26/15, enjoyed 10/31/15.  Clear golden, with a fluffy white head and sticky lace. Aroma is loaded with citrusy hops. Juicy orange, grapefruit, lemon, some dankness, some pine. A little sweet malt too.  Flavor is juicy hops. Grapefruit, orange, fresh pine, all intermingled with a light malty sweetness.

Crisp, very slightly copper body with a golden tint and a thick, dense, four centimetre tall off-white head. Aroma of super pungent and robust fresh hops with grapefruit, pine, resin, citrus and perfumey hops - thats all that is noticeable - and in a very pungent way - nice! Medium-bodied; Assertive grassy and grapefruity flavour with some resin and hybrid hop notes of pineapple and passionfruit as well. Overall, a super pungent and fragrant/flavourful fresh hop beer with seemingly hybrid hops, and some decent perfumey and citrus/tropical fruit notes throughout. I sampled this stubby twelve ounce bottle purchased two days ago on 29-October-2015 from Whole Foods in Washington (I Street, Foggy Bottom) DC for US$2,99 sampled at home in Washington on 31-October-2015.

This is maybe not Lagunitas very best hoppy beer but I am still into it and will probably keep buying it when I see it.
On tap at Pizza Paradiso Dupont. Nice golden body with slight head. Nose is floral and citrus and inviting. Taste is hoppy and oh so good. Really good balance and texture. Easy fiish.
Citrus and sharp pine. Good malt backbone. Good balance. Bitter finish. Bottle from whole foods that I drank yesterday.

Pint at Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Real good aroma, sweet. Pine, mint, lemon. Clean golden orange color , good head that faded quick. Good lace. Bitter sweet flavor. On tap at Cedar Creek Pub. Flown in the day before. Pours gold with head and lace. Aroma of straw, pine, and pineapple hops. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich grains, pine & straw hops. Overall darn tasty!

Last year this was my beer of the year and I think it was as this listing says, 7.5%. This year bottle says 6.5%, it tastes great fresh light citrus, but it doesnt have the depth and body of last years.

Sampled on 10/29/15. This India Pale Ale pours a light orange gold color from a 12oz bottle. Medium to large sized white foamy head. Awesome golden pour white head great lace. Fresh citrus and dank. Soft malt base bread grain a little sulfur. Big citrus oily juicy fruit and dank. Resinous pale malt a little bred. Lingering dank as fuck beer. Fuck yeah. Maybe best fresh hop so far.

Pours clear golden orange with a large white-ish head. The aroma has pine, powder, floral, tropical and green leafy hoppiness. Very inviting. It has a medium body with a bit of roughness with the carbonation. The flavor starts with pine, grapefruit, floral and light woodiness along with some pretty dry malt. The finish sweetens up a bit and has very big, but gentle hops. Really solid IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 11/17/2016. Pours very hazy bright golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge grapefruit, peach, pineapple, tangerine, mango, melon, passion fruit, papaya, berry, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of bright/dank citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge grapefruit, peach, pineapple, tangerine, mango, melon, passion fruit papaya, berry, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine/citrus rind/spicy/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango, melon, passion fruit, papaya, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/dank citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately sticky/resinous/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/dank citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink. An insanely amazing offering.

Bottle from beer junction. Hoppy but not overly so. Lemon, melon and some vegetable aroma. A slight bit of resin on the back end. Really juicy and really nice.

Fresh hop ales arent new by any means, but few of them reveal the dedication of Born Yesterday. Bottled and shipped the same day, Born Yesterday is about as crisp as you can get. Clear gold here, very light for a pale which is very promising. Surpringly good melon and tropical fruit notes in the aroma. Juicy fruit. Unfortunately quite a bit astringent. Draft at Bricks. Pours clear amber with nice white head. Nose and taste is delicious dank, floral, citrus, pine. Creamy mouthfeel. Great.
12 ounce bottle. Super fresh. Just bottled. Must have come from Chicago. Big floral notes. Grapefruit juice. Light sweet malt. Excellent.

Draft. Golden pour with white head. Full citrus and grassy hop aromas. Grassy, citrus, light herbal Flavors. Fresh, I guess thats the point.
