Taste is bitter dank citrus piny hops little pepper bite and well balanced bready malt backing. Palate is thin oily buttery and solid carbonation. Really good!
Nice earthy onion fragrents. Clear gold with nice frothy head. Earthy hops hit and clean to a smooth finish. The hops stain your mouth and reappear after the sip.
Pours a nice golden color with nice lacing and some head retention. Smells slightly floral and hoppy with nice piney notes. This would be the definition of my ultimate session beer!

Very pale orange, no haze, dissipating bubbles. Sweet floral aroma with muted tropical touches, honey-lacquered. Bright, juicy flavor with white peach and clementine, plant matter bitterness is almost nonexistent. Sticky hop oils, weed-like in flashes but always focused on fruity sweetness; mostly clean pale malts so this is generally not so sugary despite its sweet disposition. Punchy carbonation, somewhat top heavy in texture as it can seem both weighty and hollowed out at the same time. Somewhat extended, lavender candy finish.

Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy gold pour with a thick white head. Walls of lace. Fragrant citrus floral resins. Lemon thyme. Clementines. Unripe bananas. Celery hearts. Grapefruit pith and zest. Apricot fuzz. Pineapple cores. Fresh oak. Bright, juicy and succulent. Solid and well balanced. Clean but with a long dry finish. Like it quite a bit but not towards the top of the best IPAs for me. Maybe just a bit too refined.

Draught @ Brouwers Café in Nov 2014: &nbsp Super hoppy aroma, nice had and lacing, lively carbonation. &nbsp Flavorful without being bitter. &nbsp Lots of hop flavor but its not all that bitter. &nbsp Fresh, comes across as a Pale Ale tho. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Super clean finish, lingering hop oils. &nbsp Simple, clean, and refreshing. &nbsp Outstanding stuff.

Keg at the Green Dragon, PDX, 11/11/14.
Clear golden with a decent off white covering.
Nose is fresh hops, juicy citric peel, pine, light floral notes, grapefruit.
Taste comprises pine needle, bitter grapefruit, orange pith, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop rinse.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice pine, resin into some nice citrus with orange peel, slight spice into some slight biscuity notes. Taste was big hops, nice pine, grass, slight lemon into orange, touch of grapefruit with a hint of bread, finishing slightly spicy, bitter.
12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head . Aroma of pine, tropical fruit and malts. Taste is fruit, resin, citrus and malts.

[Tap] Light orange pour with a quickly receding fizzy head. Nose is of fresh hops, tropical fruits, pine needles and mild perfume. Flavors of tangerine, papaya, apricot, bready malts, grapefruit rind and more pine. Creamy body. Very fresh tasting. Sticky finish. Very nice.

12oz bottle. Pours light amber with a white head. Citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, a little resinous, earthy. Good stuff. I love the regular Dogtown and this is just as good in a different way.

Mosaic, Amarillo, and Equinox hops for 2014.

Borned 10.27.14.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a Lagunitas glass on 11.02.14.

A: I can smell from an arms length while pouring. Lots of grapefruit, pine, orange and mango. Hop resin is there too.

A: 1 finger head that is retained. See through orange body.

T: Grapefruit, green vegetable, orange, and mango. Mango and orange linger.

P: Crisp and bubbly. Nice carbonation that comes out on the back end.

O: It sold out at a local bottle shop in a day. I managed to scrounge some from another shop and then went back for the second delivery. Needless to say, it is an excellent fresh hop.

Thank you to my friend Derek for this generous gift. Pours a clear golden with a full, slowly settling white head. A very fresh aroma consists of floral hops pine, resin, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, and orange. Its very appealing. The taste has a good amount of bitterness with just a sweet touch. It has a solid combination of pine, orange and grapefruit up front. Additional impressions of peach, lemon, and apricot are found underneath. Lots of citrus hops in here. Sharp and short aftertaste is pineapple and orange. Medium body, with a slick, juicy texture, and plenty of carbonation. This is a first rate IPA here. Im not sure Ive found anything better than this from Lagunitas.

Appearance: Pours a slightly hazy amber tinted gold with a foamy white head. Plenty of visible rising bubbles.
Aroma: Tangerine, grapefruit, resinous Jack Hererer. Pine.

Taste: Fresh orange/tangerine flesh and pith. Stone fruit, toasted malt followed by earthy bitter finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, juicy. Carbonation is average for the style of beer.

Overall: First and foremost, this was a fantastic, fresh delicious beer that happens to be my favorite style of beer. The concept of a fresh hop beer being bottled and delivered in 24 hours is noble. However, I live in the land of hoppy beers (Southern California), where I have had beers that have rivaled the level of aroma and flavor. Im very happy Lagunitas is using their power and influence to teach the importance of protecting hop freshness and fresh beer as a whole. Lets hope other craft breweries take notice and not count on the masses not caring about this particular topic.

36cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Alejandro for bringing this over!, complex bitter brew, malty/fruity/bitter and slightly floral/woody, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew

Bottle from imstilltheGman. Grassy ass sir! Light orange in color. Big rocky head that leaves a good lacing on the glass. Killer nose on this one.... Tropical fruits exploding on my ole factory. California can do IPAs right. Light body with a good amount of carbonation. Tons of tropical fruit notes. Citrus, mango, pineapple, grapefruit! Some flowers and perfume.. really easy to drink. I wish the alcohol content was a little lower, but still good because it is not noticeable. Overall nothing but good things to say about this beer. If you find some please send it my way. Side note this pairs well with chet fakers no diggity live.

Bottle from craft beer store next to Ballast Point; shared with Paul. Pours a light golden body with a healthy portion of frothy white head. Lacing lasts throughout. Aroma is super pungent pine, light dank character and pepper. Mouthfeel is perfectly crisp and refreshing with notes of fresh pine, dank herb, fresh grapefruit, fresh grass and a nice light balance of crackery malts which gives the hoppy pine/grassy flavor a nice counter. Another really great offering from Lagunitas - hope we get this on the east coast.

First from a 6 pack dropped off in my backyard from Mr. Roach, then from the last 2 6 packs at BevMo. Pours a near clear, light orange/gold with a disappearing head. Aroma is fresh hops, very fresh hops, super fresh hops and fruit! Taste is what makes this beer - its lightly carbonated and thin to medium. You can drink this all day! Thats something that is only possible by drinking this hop bomb a few days after its brewed. Similar to Stones Enjoy By but instead of a IIPA, this is a Pale Ale version. So much better than Dogtown PA - they ought to change the recipe and just sell this instead. Taste is fresh pine, lots of tropical and stone fruits, with zesty citrus, with a honey-like sweetness at the end. This is what Sierra Nevada PA wishes to be. Try this if you ever get a chance. One of a kind.

Draft at Slaters 50/50. Pours almost clear gold with a fizzy bubbly off white head and lots of lacing. Tastes like musky, leathery, orange, grapefruit, and dry pine hops. Light body and low carbonation. Light/medium body and blow carbonation. Smells like grapefruit, pine, and sweet candy.

From a 12 oz bottle. 
Aroma is super hop forward with lots of tropical fruit and melon notes. Moderate citrus character and light pine with a light malt backbone. This beer smells great. 
Pours a fairly clear golden orange with a large, slightly off white head that displays nice retention and great lacing. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a medium light cracker malt note. Medium bitterness with quite a bit of hop flavor. Moderate citrus and light pine resin notes. Nice tropical fruit character with longs of mango and light stone fruit notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a super hoppy, really nice pale ale. Hops work great with the malt character and are very fresh and fruity.

Draft. Very softly clouded tangerine, with a pillowy off-white head. The aroma is just incredible -- if I didnt know this was beer, Id swear it was a tropical drink made of fresh-squeezed juices, served on some temperate beach near the equator. Tangerine peel, mango, pineapple, cotton candy, honeysuckle, baked sugar cookies. Crazy-fresh, crazy-vibrant nose. The flavor has more of a citrusy bite, with sharp grapefruit peel and wet grass to go along with subtle juicyfruit tones. Bitterness is predictably substantial, tugging on the sides of the tongue. A touch of honey sweetness brings balance to the hop bomb, carrying into a clean finger-snap of a finish. As bright and vibrant as a fresh-hopped beer can possibly be. Superb.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Pours a bright clear orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of floral citrus (grapefruit, orange, and lemon), pine, tropical fruits, sweet malts, floral hops, apricots, and light dankness. Taste is zesty fresh citrus, pine, tropical fruits, apricots, light sweet malts, and some light bready malts. Has a medium body with a super creamy mouthfeel and a semi-moderately bitter, semi dry, long finish. Overall, a excellent fresh hop ale that has a great hop aroma and taste without the excessive bitterness and is also very drinkable for a 7.5 abv beer. It my just be my new favorite Lagunitas beer (right up there with hop stoopid).

Amazing aroma. Great stickiness on the palate. brilliant use of hops
Not shy with the bitterness, but well tucked behind the crazy bright hop flavor.
Wonderful use of hops and a great beverage. Lagunitas knocked this one out of the park.

Aromas of grapefruit, pine, citrus peel. Taste is of a solid pale ale. Fresh hop comes out very nice. Delicious!

Top 5 pale ale I have ever had. Super grapefruitty and hoppy and bitter. Pours a light yellow color with a white head. Smells citruscy. Best beer lagunitas has ever made.

Tap and sampled from bottle too... Poured clear, pale golden with a moderate head. Aroma if dense citrus juice, pine, and floral/perfumy hops. Hop flavors were similar to the nose. Well carbonated, lively and not too heavy mouthfeel. Bittering hops and still balance as it lightened up towards the finish.

Pours a finger of head on a clear straw body.
The aroma is grain and pine.
The taste is a burst of pine and lemon. Quite nice.
The texture is crisp..
Really nice.

On druaght at both Spreads in Campbell and Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City. Massive citrus and slight, balanced dank aroma. Orange and clear with full white head. Flavor follows aroma - this is Lagunitas knocking it out of the park with a hop bomb and well balanced and restrained bitterness.

Draft. Nice one. Pours llgolden with some head. Big citrus hop nose, taste the northwest! More hop flavor than hop bitterness. Balancing malt sweetness. Smooth, almost creamy mouthfeel. A very good fresh hop brew.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Bottle from Beaumont. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. A huge, I mean massive citrus nose. Rich citrus, pine, massive late boil goodness, more than a bit of the all powerful Zombie Dust in this. Just lovely. Soft, but big. This is the future...seriously. Lovely.

12 oz. bottle. Hazed golden pour with thick sticky white head. Aroma of fresh, delicious, earthy dank hops. Flavor is mildly bitter with huge hop flavors. Flavor is mildly bitter with medium sweetness. Definite juicy, fruity notes. Medium bodied, lively body, with lingering bitterness in the finish. Overall, a pretty nice beer.
Bottle. Juicy grapefruit and pine trees with a mellow caramel sweetness in the background. Mild bitterness throughout. So much fresh hoppy goodness. Solid finish. Tasty.

Amazing fresh hop aroma. Easily the best fresh hop beer I have ever tasted. I cant get over the amazing citrus aromas. The citrus taste is fantastic. 
The restrained bitterness in comparison to a typical IPA make this a great session beer while it is available. So fresh and delicious. Also amazing price at $9 a six pack. In the hands of another brewery this is $9 bomber.

This beer has a very sweet citrus aroma and a mild sweet flavor that turns into a hoppy flavor as it develops on your tongue. Very very good.

Light straw yellow, one finger head. Smell is tangerine, marijuana, warm citrus. Taste is dry; blood orange, some pine/woody flavor. Nice clean flavor and body.

Tap at Hopleaf. This is amazing. Slightly hazy light orange pour with a white head. Tangerine and grapefruit explosion on the aroma. Juicy citrusy taste. Low malt. Everything I could want in an IPA. Killer!

Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with creamy white head that settled. Aroma is caramel, huge tangerine, papaya, melon, citrus oil. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a medium body and zesty carbonation. Taste is sweet followed by a nice hop bitterness that lingers throughout. Overall this is acwonderful brew.

Aromas of grapefruit, pine, citrus peel. Taste is of a solid pale ale. Fresh hop comes out very nice. Delicious

Golden orange in color... Aroma of fresh citrus hops, tangerines, grapefruit... Flavor is light and dry, slight citrus fruitiness initially, gives way to a sticky dry citrus and floral hop bitterness, vegetables and slight sweetness on finish... Great beer, can taste the freshness

Bottle @ home. Slightly chill hazed bright orange with a dense off-white head. Nose is super floral and fragrant. Big time grapefruit and orange peels. Nice peach, tangerine, lemon peel, and some bready malt. Wowe, such hops! Sort of a sweet caramel, bread, and apricot flavor. Tons of bitter pine and grapefruit. Very floral and citrusy. A touch of garlic on the finish. Damn good.

Gorgeous orange iridescent color, thin white head, lightly resinous surface. Lots of citrus aromas along with signature lagunitas sulfur aromas diesel and a bit of gunpowder, feel is medium heft, lightly creamy, considerable dissolved CO2, tangy. Lightly bitter sweet. Bits of light cocoa. Wow.

As good as it gets for me. Pours a golden yellow color with a nice head. Immediately the smell of hops, lemon zest and tangerines explode from the glass. Taste is crisp and refreshing, extremely intoxicating. Pineapple, apricots and grapefruit come first. Some bitterness from the hops comes through but just enough to provide great balance. Great finish with more crispness. My new favorite beer.
Huge fruity, perfumey nose. Flavor is mango, blueberry, grass, resin/dank, mild grapefruit rind, light crackery malt sweetness.

P: Dark orange with a thin lacing. S: Tropical fruits, pine and citrus residue, cotton candy, melon and for the most part its all hops. 6 pack bought at Whole Foods, Fremont. Cannot get enough of this. Clean, citrus hoppy with a very nuanced, subtle malt backbone. This is a very superior, special event APA. Not an IPA.

Aroma of citrus and lemon. Taste is citrus topical lemon and hoppy. Delicious. One of the better Lagunitas ipa. Had this poured from draft at Whole Foods lincoln park. Yellow clear with sticky white head. They need to keep this one in regular production

Draft. Along side a double dry hopped non fresh hop version. This is the fresh hop version of this, assuming the regular version. They relaly upped hte ante on dogtown, its now a sucks-esque dipa. Quite a turnaround.

Tap. Pours clear orange, small of white head, decent lacing. powerful aroma of citrus, tropical, guava, mango, graoefruit. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, tropical and juicy. Light body. Really tasty.
Really liked this pale ale. Hoppy but not too bitter. Smooth and piney. Warming on a cold day.

Draft at SB. Tapped this two days after it was kegged. 900 miles away. NICE! I got here a day later. Pours a hazy medium amber with bright orange highlights. Dense and creamy tan head that sticks around for quite a while. Huge bright oily intense nose, showing explosive grapefruit shocks as soon as you get the glass within a foot of your face. Its like biting into a ripe one. If you have a score to settle with grapefruits, you, sir, may face your demons here. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly toasted caramel with bright piercing grapefruit bite all over the place, washing out into a sharp pithy pinch of a finish. Everything about this beer is refreshing and delicious and easily worth many repeats. I think I only got 5 in 2 days before it kicked. Need a lot more of this.

Draft pour at Bottleworks. Pours a light golden color with a sharp bitter aroma. A decent amount of hop character on the flavor. Pretty bitter throughout. Love the hops in this. But the beer doesn?t stand out completely. A lot of grapefruit and citrus in the finish.  Enjoyed this.

Pours a golden color with a white head. Citrus, hop and floral aroma. Lemon, mango, grapefruit, orange, hop, floral and herb flavors. Moderate bitterness. Light body and average carbonation. Citrus finish.

Technically born the day before yesterday for me. Bottle dated 10/27/14, tasted on 10/29/14. It pours a nice clear gold color, pretty light with an off white head. The aroma is very potent with the typical Lagunitas sweet hoppiness. Ruby red grapefruit, papaya, a little onion spice and just a touch of florals. The flavor is equally as potent with a drier, danker mouthfeel. A little onion and pine combine with the sweet fruity hops for nice balance. Im guessing this is one of those beers where "fresh hop" doesnt mean "wet hop" since it avoids the astringent, oily and chemical-like mouthfeel that I usually get from wet hop IPAs. Very good stuff. On par with Sucks IMO.
One of the best beers for me in 2014. Big citrus aroma. Orange and grapefruit everywhere. Lots of bitterness here. More IPA than pale. On par with Sucks for big flavor.
On tap st Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark blonde with a nice off-white head and a citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a very bitter finish. Crisp, clean and tasty.
Pours Amber with a good inch of egg shell colored head. Huge floral, tropical fruit nose. Great bitterness and malt balance. Lasting bitterness in the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Expected and was excited about a fresh hop pale ale, even more excited about a 7.5% dank-leaning IPA! Mosaic hops steal the show though Amarillo and Equinox are there to dankify and bitter up the waves of tropical fruit from the mosaics. Light malt, very smooth and drinkable. Fantastic aroma and flavor. One of their best beers, and best new six-pack beer Ive had in a while.
Ridiculously aromatic fresh hop beer...light malt bill allows the hops to steal the show and they do not disappoint...

Tap at The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours brassy gold with a creamy white head. Aroma seems cascade, but I wouldnt be surprised if some Nelson or mosaic were present. Med body. Its fruity/fresh, hint of citrus, and arguably a bit dank. For me theres a suggestion of NZ hop. Its quite hoppy, quite bitter, and tastes really good.
